title: Entourage (South Korean TV series)
text:
Entourage () is a <a href="Korean%20drama">South Korean television series</a> starring <a href="Cho%20Jin-woong">Cho Jin-woong</a>, <a href="Seo%20Kang-joon">Seo Kang-joon</a>, <a href="Lee%20Kwang-soo">Lee Kwang-soo</a>, <a href="Park%20Jung-min%20%28actor%29">Park Jung-min</a> and <a href="Lee%20Dong-hwi">Lee Dong-hwi</a>. It is a <a href="Black%20comedy">black</a> <a href="comedy-drama">comedy-drama</a> about life in the entertainment industry, based on the <a href="Entourage%20%28American%20TV%20series%29">American television series of the same name</a>. It started airing on cable network <a href="TVN%20%28South%20Korean%20TV%20channel%29">tvN</a> from November 4, 2016, and finished airing on December 24, 2016.
The series scored low ratings in South Korea; some have argued that the low ratings were a result of the series being atypical of Korean dramas, particularly its black humour and perhaps American vibe.
Synopsis.
This is the story of a handsomely famous celebrity who depends on his three friends and agency's boss who try to help him in his struggles as an actor and a man.
Production.
Development and Filming.
First script reading took place on May 28, 2016 at CJ E&M Center in Sangamdong, Seoul, South Korea. Filming began on June 1, 2016 at a club in Gangnam, Seoul, South Korea; and wrapped up on September 26, 2016.
"Entourage" was entirely pre-produced. The airing rights to the show were sold to China for 300,000 USD per episode.
